contextId.information: People would show their king that they were loyal to him by kissing him, perhaps on the feet. AT: "Show the son that you are truly loyal to him" or "Bow down humbly before his son" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])

People snort at their enemies when they think that their enemies are weak and worthless. AT: "he thinks that all his enemies are weak and worthless" or "he sneers at all his enemies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
contextId.quote: he snorts at all his enemies

contextId.information: This seems to refer to a ritual washing of hands in water to symbolize freedom from sin and guilt. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
contextId.quote: I wash my hands in innocence

contextId.information: This was a symbol of prayer. "with my head bent down in prayer" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
contextId.quote: with my head bowed on my chest

contextId.information: Here, to raise one's hand is a gesture of victory. This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh has exalted his right hand" or "Yahweh has raised his right hand in victory" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The right hand of Yahweh is exalted

contextId.information: This is how people prayed or praised God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
Bowing down is a symbolic action that represents worship and giving honor. AT: "I will worship you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
This is a sign of being arrogant. AT: "are arrogant" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
